website_summaries.verdict: If a lightweight design is important to you, this is a solid choice. You won't have to sacrifice power for maneuverability, as it provides both.
pros: Stands out for being extremely lightweight yet powerful
Simple to use in tight spaces and to carry up and down stairs
cons: Requires replacement bags and filters and is somewhat noisy

customer_reviews.title: The quality of product parts on this vacuum is extremely poor. Every time I use it
customer_reviews.text: I have been a loyal Oreck customer for many years. This purchase, however, is one I very much regret. The quality of product parts on this vacuum is extremely poor. Every time I use it, something else on it breaks. The strap and plastic nozzle broke almost immediately. Although it is only a year old, it looks like it has been in use for decades....it is only being held together by lots and lots of duct tape. My loyalty to Oreck products is over. I will never buy another Oreck product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I used to have one of these and it was great. Whoever manufactures it now has really ruined the product. I bought a new home and bought this to suck dust from high cabinets. First use the shoulder strap broke and I nearly fell off a 12' ladder to catch it. Next the attachments broke. I'd return it if I hadn't trashed the box. Don't buy this!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Flyingdiver

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy consumer.
customer_reviews.text: This is without a doubt the most un-user friendly vacuum that I have ever used. The hose is short and not pliable, the extensions will not stay together and pick up is just okay. I spend more time putting the extensions back together that I do actually vacuuming. Tried using rubber bands and tape on ends to make it tighter but that didn't work either.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this, I wanted a light weight vacuum for my one bedroom condo, and for my car. It looked fantastic. I did read a review about the vacuum falling off the the shoulder strap, and I thought, this is an Oreck, there is no way that review was true. Well, it was accurate. The shoulder strap system is very flimsy. The vacuum fell off and hit my toe. I am very lucky that my toe is not broken. I did bleed like crazy however and got blood all over my carpet. Do not buy! You will be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ruscitti

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke easily, hazard alert!
customer_reviews.text: This is a poorly designed vacuum cleaner, the strap broke off on my second use, it hit my bare foot that caused a bruise and worst of all, when it fell off my shoulder, it also damaged the wall. Without the strap, it is very heavy and awkward to lug it around, not to mention the danger and hazard that may cause. The hoses came off easily and the attachments have bad angles. I noticed many reviewers have the same strap problems, Oreck, are you listening? You should ratify this strap safety hazard before something serious happened?
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: This is not a good residential vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good residential vacuum. There is no hepa filter in the rear and blows a hard stream of air. If you have pets the hair you are trying to get rid of is blowing behind you.
customer_reviews.author: willibgood

customer_reviews.title: I remembered using the portable Oreck when I worked for a house cleaning service 20 years ago and I thought it was awesome, but I must say that this one is ...
customer_reviews.text: I appreciated finding this at such an affordable price, but you get what you pay for! I remembered using the portable Oreck when I worked for a house cleaning service 20 years ago and I thought it was awesome, but I must say that this one is much flimsier. The attachments and hose parts are constantly falling off while I vacuum. Very frustrating. The 20 year ago model seemed very sturdy and functional. This one barely works.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Suction and awkward to work with. Does not live to what you would expect from Oreck.
customer_reviews.text: Very uncomfortable and awkward to work with between hanging it over your shoulder and way too long of a cord to the point that it’s frustrating. Would be a lot easier to maneuver if the hose attachment was longer. The wand attachments are cheap and plastic , not what you would expect from Oreck. NO comparison to the powerful upright. Used once and put back in box and returned immediately! There are other small uprights that are much more powerful and better made. Not worth the money even at a discounted price. Wouldn’t want it if it was free .
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended due to poor engineering of attachments
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this vacuum for a few months now and definitely wished I had purchased a different vacuum. I like the compact nature and definitely the sturdy electrical cord, however, the wand and attachments frequently fall off while vacuuming. It is very frustrating to have this happen several times while vacuuming. Also, the vacuum bag capacity is super small and requires frequent replacing. This vacuum replaced another the Eureka platinum vacuum. I didn't purchase that vacuum again because the other was only available as part of a bundle. I mistakenly thought the Oreck would be of superior quality due to the brand name but the frustrations outweigh the usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Ham

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPLY MADE - NOT THE ORECK YOU KNEW
customer_reviews.text: 1. The strap to carry vacuum is so cheaply put together now that it will not hold, coming apart while vacuuming, scrapping my knee and making me bleed. 2. Tools are so cheaply made that they are hard to use. 3. Hose is a piece of junk, not like the old hose - so bad tool will not stay connected 4. Tools and tubes come apart constantly while attempting to use vacuum. I ended up dragging the piece of junk holding tool together with one hand while holding the vacuum by the handle with the other. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. The one good thing I can say is that it still has plenty of suction.
customer_reviews.author: Believer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Suction
customer_reviews.text: This is a good car-vac. The one that I had from about 2004 had the hose come apart, three years of duct taping it gave out. Cost of repair to getting new led me to getting this newer version and it did good taking the salt from the console from the SC trip, also the sand from the carpet. The cord is long enough that an extension isn't needed to get to the driveway. Only con would be it does not have a grounded plug. Thought the "commercial" models did.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, quality issues.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second one - I had the exact same issues with both items. In both cases the strap gives out causing the vacuum to fall off of your shoulders (it's a bad design). The plastic attachments crack, split and break. I used black duct tape to patch the attachments, but they have now given out completely. Buyer beware. Bad product. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: BSF

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I had one and my dog chewed the cord. I was so mad because it's the best little vacuum ever. It never lost suction and was amazing at getting 3 German Shepherd's hair out of my SUV and so much better than the super vac that eats all your quarters. This came with so many nice attachments too. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kiana CTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around portable vacuum cleaner for small spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had it long enough to find anything awful about it, but so far, I love it. I bought it because it was advertised as weighing only 5 pounds. It is easy to carry as I clean, and does a terrific job. I doubt that you could find more powerful suction on such a light-weight machine. My biggest problem was putting it together, but I managed that. Also, t is pretty easy to store out of the way in a small closet. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Commercial Oreck XL Handheld BB900- Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I just bought the commercial version of the Oreck XL handheld vacuum. It's great. There are so many improvements and lots of attachments included. It is lightweight, so you really do not need the shoulder strap. The cord is really long so I can plug it into one outlet and vacuum an entire 17 x 20 floor room without running out of cord. The wand telescopes so there's no taking tubes apart when you need to vacuum close up or reach the tops of blinds or high corners. Really love it!
customer_reviews.author: las911

customer_reviews.title: but better because it has a longer cord
customer_reviews.text: My old Oreck cannister vac died after 8 faithful years of service. This is the same, but better because it has a longer cord, and the cord is red, so highly visible. They did not think to make the prongs that hold the cord longer as you wrap up the cord to put the vac away, so there's a lot of overhand, but that's my only criticism. The attachments are also nicer than 8 years ago as there is a telescoping wand rather than two wands you have to attach to each other.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Adams

customer_reviews.title: What a difference with this Oreck!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a difference with this Oreck!!! Pet hair hasn't got a chance against the power of this commercial vacuum. It's easy & convenient to use in every room including the stairs. The extra-long cord eliminates the headaches of unplugging and replugging in another location. I can clean dust & spider webs from the ceiling with the expandable hose. This is one of the best purchases I have made on Amazon! Plus, with Subscribe & Save, I can get the bags as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Madd Maxx

customer_reviews.title: I prefer the Super Deluxe version
customer_reviews.text: I had the Super Deluxe (XL) version for years and used it until all the parts were taped together. I decided to get a new Oreck canister and went with the commercial version because I liked the idea of a longer cord. The commercial cord is such a pain as it is not pliable, stays tangled up, and is heavy. The vacuum has good suction but the unit gets warm if you use it more than a few minutes. If I had to do it again, I would buy the XL.
customer_reviews.author: KJH

customer_reviews.title: Two reasons I am not pleased with this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Two reasons I am not pleased with this vacuum: the suction is not what I expected, small items to include head hairs are not picked up. The other dislike is the main hose falls out from and needs to be reconnected to the vacuum housing, and the extension wand does not stay connected to the main hose. It's a shame for this well known brand (Oreck) to have these design flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Haro

customer_reviews.title: Inconvient vaccum, already broke and only 8 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst vaccum I have ever owned. The strap broke a week into using it and not even a year yet and the hose is so bent it won't allow anything to be sucked up and is causing it to overheat!! The cord is very heavy and a nuisance. The head of the attachment is perfect size, but opening to suck up dirt is angled odd and plugs easily. Terrible vaccuum! Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy0418

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaws
customer_reviews.text: We had our last Oreck handheld vac for ten years before it stopped working. We decided to go with the commercial grade thinking it would be even more durable than our original vac. Wrong. The strap has a design flaw and both sides of the nylon snapped by the third use, and we’ve had to rig something to hold both sides in place on the vac. (See photos.) Wishing we’d kept our old strap! The vacuum extender we use to sweep our hardwoods does not stay on well, and we find we have to hold it in place while we vacuum. Really disappointed that this is nothing like our original, especially when we thought we were getting something more delux.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good compact vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have had this vacuum for over two months now. I was worried that it wasn't going to be a good quality item because of some of the bad reviews but It's turned out to be great. They would have you believe if you didn't treat it like a faberge egg it would break. Not the case, my vacuum has been knocked off tables and has seen liberal use around the house and I haven't had any issues with it so far. My only complaint is there is no place to store the extension handle or the head that attaches to it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Bad Hose Extensions
customer_reviews.text: Over the years Oreck has completely ignored the hose extension problem with their hand held models. The extensions are too short, and they disconnect while vacuuming. For a company that promotes itself a leader in the industry, and charges big money for their products they obviously don't have a quality control group for their hand held vacuum cleaners. If they did this problem would have been resolved years ago. Until they resolve this problem I recommend everyone avoid purchasing the handhelds.
customer_reviews.author: High Note

customer_reviews.title: I love walking around with this thing draped off my shoulder- ...
customer_reviews.text: I love walking around with this thing draped off my shoulder- I feel like a ghost buster! The way that the flexible tube connects with the extending handle is not that tight and requires that I hold it below where they link up. I would like a more secure connection - but for this little machine, that is not much of an issue. This is more of a utility vacuum, than a main household machine. But the price and the convenience of getting into corners, edges,and under things easily makes it a perfect trouble shooter, small room machine.
customer_reviews.author: John McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum....powerful suction.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has great suction....therefore, it does not suck! Great for vacuuming the car....versatile and good attachments gets every nook and cranny in the car. Not so good on indoor carpets. GREAT on hard floors and getting up into higher regions. Not very helpful on curtains, too much suction power. Well worth the asking price. I have 30 years hotel, housekeeping experience, so I have used MANY types and brands of vacuums, including big boy brands like Kirby and Electrolux....this is just as good!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Burchard

customer_reviews.title: Great suck but cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to work on the stairs. I used the extension and started cleaning my stairs after taking it out of the box. It took about 2 minutes before the extension tube cracked. I did not apply a lot of force. I figured it stated it was commercial so I assumed that meant commercial grade. I was wrong. The only reason it doesn't get 1 star is because the suction of this vacuum is excellent. A lot of people like this machine but it broke in my hands within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carle

customer_reviews.title: Hooked it all up and it is great for cleaning corners and windowsills which is why I ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received it yesterday. Hooked it all up and it is great for cleaning corners and windowsills which is why I bought it. My upright has no attachments so this is awesome! I used a camera strap rather than the flimsy one that came with it after reading all the issues with the strap hooks breaking. Being a photographer I had a extra laying around 😀 will update if anything goes wrong later after my fall cleaning is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Jules

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as I had hoped. Small and very useful. Some of the very fine particulates get past this filter so keep a room air cleaner going. Only the very fine. The strap is a little weak at the connection to the vacuum and needs to be looped through the hole and use the cloth end to attach to the strap. I had the vacuum drop on my foot and that wont happen again doing it this way.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M Wing

customer_reviews.title: The cord winds and tangles.
customer_reviews.text: The 30 foot red cord winds up among itself in spots and becomes difficult to keep unwound, turning my 30 foot cord into a 10-12 foot cord. I contacted Oreck customer service and they would only said this: "Unfortunately, we do not have any troubleshooting concerning the cord. Please straighten out the cord prior to storing the unit, then wind the cord loosely." Yes, that had already occurred to me, to straighten out the cord, but It won't stay straightened. This is my fourth Oreck vacuum. Maybe my last.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: It has no wheels!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful, this is not like the other models of the Oreck Cannister VAc. I am so disappointed bc I’ve always bought Oreck, always loved them. This on has no wheels, must be used while it’s being carried . I’m 5 ft tall, so it’s very bulky and difficult to vacuum. The hose keeps un attaching at 2 joints, So difficult to keep it attached. It’s more trouble than it’s worth. But it does have great suction. Why doesn’t it have wheels??
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth armstrong kolodziejski

customer_reviews.title: doesn't seem commercial grade
customer_reviews.text: It's really small and the hose is short. and the disposable bag is really small. Thought it would work good for my rental cars but my employees don't like it. So going to look for something else and give this one away.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Received my bedding today perfect. i am very unhappy with the two orecks ...
customer_reviews.text: Received my bedding today perfect.i am very unhappy with the two orecks I bought in march, i opened one but had little suction the other one the same.i didn't feel I needed to opened the day I got them .they look very new but not enough power to pick up crumbs on a floor .ive always bought an oreck with never a problem until now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my 5 lb Oreck
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has unbelievable power and only weighs 5 its. Comes with all the necessary tools. Only cons is that the hose slips off sometimes and they should have designed with a click on to the long tube accessory. Another desirable addition would have been if they at least to roller wheels so one doesn't have to carry the unit if vacuuming floors; Otherwise, best deal and better suction then my Electrolox.
customer_reviews.author: M. Van Remoortere

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I am a longtime fan of Oreck. I have used the upright which is very light weight and easy to maneuver and to keep clean 4 almost thirty years, But I'm disappointed in this product. To be a portable vacuum, it is quite heavy for me. and I feel it would work much better if it had a longer hose. It needs wheels also. If you have trouble maneuvering a vacuum, if you have trouble holding a few pounds in your hand and working with the other hand, then this product is not for you. I very seldom ever use it. I am totally disappointed in this Oreck product.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this until it is redesigned.
customer_reviews.text: This small sweeper is just all wrong. The hose is to short The exhaust is in the back and it blows everything behind me straight into the room. The part that came with sweeper to redirect the exhaust will not stay in place. There are no wheels so that can be pulled around furniture. The long floor pipe will not stay connected. I am very disappointed. Janet
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: All the advantages of the Oreck Standard plus longer Cord and better suction.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the standard Oreck canister for about 20 years and like the fact that it’s light weight and can be easily carried to wherever it’s needed. The Oreck Commercial has these advantages And in addition has better suction. The longer cord is also nice to have. It’s much easier to do steps with it compared to our upright. My old standard model is still going strong. Hope the new one is of equal quality- it appears to be. Very pleased with our new Oreck Commercial. Also, the Commercial was less expensive than the standard, not sure why...
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Just like the other one I had
customer_reviews.text: I had an Oreck Buster B forever, and this is a great replacement ... some great suction and for about $100, is a great handheld vacuum. I dont do my whole house with this ... I have a central vac and an upright, but I use this for my car and quick cleanups. The attachments are useful and work with all my old ones. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a small cleaner upper.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Schaub

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to move around. Heavy to carry on the shoulder.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use. Clean corners well but is hard to slide when is used as a vacuum cleaner . Is heavy to carry on the shoulder and not very practical to move around. I will not advise to buy it .
customer_reviews.author: Flor Martinez

customer_reviews.title: This product is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst vacuum I have ever owned. It is only the second cannister type vacuum, but it is horrible. The description said it had a 4 foot hose; it is actually less than 3 1/2 feet. I assumed that was the length of the hose before extension, but that is not the case, my fault. I tried to buy a longer hose, but that is not available. The attachments will not stay attached, but continually come apart. It has wonderful suction, but that doesn't help if the vacuum lacks usability and this one certainly does.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Hot and Heavy!
customer_reviews.text: A great little vac for an RV except that it really is hot and heavy! I think the guys will not be bothered by those things, but I am. No other review that I saw mentioned that it really does run very hot. I use it hanging on my side so I really feel it. Also, I am no weakling and this does get heavy as well. Also, the way the strap, which is mandatory, IMO, attaches is cheap and looks very fragile.I have jury-rigged straps that go around the body to take the load off the litle clips. Otherwise, it sure can suck up the kitty litter!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only for hand held jobs
customer_reviews.text: Great suction but did not work for me. If you need two hands for a job and try to lay this on the ground, it is not stable enough to stay put. It flips and flops all over the place banging into my legs. The attachment for carpet/bare floors was useless. With vacuum on shoulder, tubing was not long enough to reach my hardwood floors to comfortably use. The other attachments are under sized. The round brush kept losing bristles as I used it. Only practical as a hand held device and I don’t want to tote it around everywhere even if it is lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: DokiDoki

customer_reviews.title: An affordable, compact vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have very little experience with this vacuum other than I received it this morning and used it only once. With that said, the vacuum comes with multiple useful attachments including a strap that allows one to carry it. My initial use was positive. It cleans very well. For the price, this vacuum is worth trying out.
customer_reviews.author: Boston, MA

customer_reviews.title: Adequate little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have owned quite a few Orecks over the last 30+ years. I don't think the quality is as good as it used to be. That said, it's still a good little canister vac for home and auto's and whatever tough area you need to vacuum. Has a lot of attachments. But I basically use three all the time. Shuts off when it gets hot. Which it has done in the middle of my vacuuming a couple of times this summer. Not at all in the winter. I still think Orecks are better than most, but bag costs have gone up too.
customer_reviews.author: JeanneBB

customer_reviews.title: Not the best choice
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this, it has great suction but is heavy to carry around and the hose is not long enough to pull around without super bending over which gets old...wish I could return but didn't save the box because it is good quality but not practical for use.
customer_reviews.author: toto

customer_reviews.title: Not Oreck Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Oreck canister vacuum, and this one is such lower quality than my original. Have owned this Oreck Pro 5 for 1 1/2 years and one of the wands cracked within a year, and now the hose has broken. My first Oreck canister lasted for years, so very disappointed in this one. Not worth ordering new parts, so will have to look into another brand I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight Vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: Just received today, works great, very light. Just need to use a safety pin to double the shoulder strap or it will slip through its holder. (others mentioned this issue) NOTE: I bought the combo with the bags, the bags sent were the wrong size... They were for the huge upright vacuum, do NOT order the combo or you will be sending the bags back... It comes with 2 small bags so I am ok for now. I cleaned my A/C intake with this like it was nothing, worth the $$$ just for that.
customer_reviews.author: DblEdge

customer_reviews.title: I have used Orecks like this for about 20 years. I probably would never use another brand.
customer_reviews.text: But they have a few problems with their new commercial version. The red cords are so very stiff. Makes it harder to use. And that new extension wand is a lovely invention, but it seems shorter than the old one. I'm 5'8" and I have to bend over just a tad too much. I did not like the floor tool, too heavy, too metal. The stretchy hose is very nice but I let my grip loosen just a bit and it almost flew out of my hand. I hope someday I can buy a non-commercial version.
customer_reviews.author: ghostwriter

customer_reviews.title: It's an Oreck - 'nuff said
customer_reviews.text: Oreck is the best vac I've ever used. Being an Oreck vac, if anything ever breaks or wears out, ALL parts are available to fix it.. Unless it is abused, a canister vac like this will last a very long time - the motor is the only moving part. There is plenty of suction, and with this set, all attachments come with the vac - very convenient. Be sure to get replacement bags, as they are small for a compact vac like this, and when full they must be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A., Philadelphia, PA

customer_reviews.title: Typical Oreck - great peformance - but bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my old Oreck hand vac last year. Plus - super long cord; great suction Con - feels heavier; long cord can be cumbersome if you don't need all of the length provided; air releases from back which can blow dust around in very dusty/dirty area; hose attachment is not as stretchy as older models which makes it feel shorter for long reach Overall, still great quality, but just wish it came with the older model hose. I am searching for one as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: ladymda

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I got this since the Oreck vacuum itself doesn't have attachments to do stairs or get in small areas. This thing has a powerful suction. The attachments are great except for the brush part that has all the hairs on it. The hairs seem to be a little long so when you attach that to use it, the hairs suck in a little blocking the path for dirt/hair to get by. So it can clog up easily but with the suction power you don't have to take it off and suck all the debris out of there very often. I think Oreck makes great products and I'm super happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Turner

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: years ago i used one it worked very well.i was able to hold it or not. this one was very uncomforable to handle while using it.could not put it down without everything falling off.the tools.it did some pick up but not everything.i dont have time to play with a vaccum .
customer_reviews.author: Marian

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little machine for its size. Seems very well made and very quiet for the amount of suction it emits. I guess the only drawback is that it uses bags, although they supply you with 2 and replacing a bag is easy enough, also inexpensive. The vacuum has a 30 foot elec. cord, plenty long enough for use in most houses. It has a handle and a strap that can go over your shoulder, easy to carry. It also comes with a few necessary attachments that fit easily on the end of the flexible hose that's provided. The other end of the vacuum can be used as a blower. All in all, it's a solid investment.
customer_reviews.author: Lee DeBree

customer_reviews.title: Preferable for residential
customer_reviews.text: I do love this vacuum in comparison to the HOOVER C2401 model because it is lighter, smaller and more functional for residential cleaning. The attachments come apart almost too easily and it is a little inconvenient for it to come apart multiple times while cleaning. I accidentally sucked up a sock while cleaning and it was hell getting it out of the long black attachment. I had to straighten out a wire hanger and push it through. It is not bag less so you will have additional costs if you are using it frequently it may be better to look into bag less.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: I had high Hope's for this vacuum, but I will admit it hasn't lived up to what I was looking for. We have a lot of steps and 3 dogs, so I really need something that will pick the dog hair up well. After seeing a friend's oric upright vac do amazing things, I had the same hope for the canister, but no. It does have ok suction, but that is where the similarity stops. The suction isn't great, the bag doesn't hold much, and despite the strap, it is still a pain to carry around. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: It really sucks - and that's good!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful little vacuum. I use it in the garage to clean out the car interior, and it works very well. I did have to do a minor repair to the loop where the shoulder sling attaches - a bit of heavy-duty upholstery thread did the job nicely. Pretty easy to maneuver around, but it does take a bit to get used to the sling. It's nice to have the very long power cord, but it takes a few seconds to rewind it when done. All in all, a very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Deep in the Heart of Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great suction!
customer_reviews.text: Thus is a good vacuum with really strong suction. We already had an Orek upright, which works great, but it didn't have any attachments. We decided to give this vacuum a try since it's also an Orek and had great reviews. Personally, I would prefer that it had wheels so I can roll it around instead of having to carry it. After a very short while it starts to feel very heavy and uncomfortable on my shoulder. However, my husband loves it this way because it makes it easy for him to vacuum out the cars.
customer_reviews.author: artist

customer_reviews.title: The vacuum doesn't suck, but the warranty does
customer_reviews.text: Hugely disappointed in this product. After using this maybe five times, it stopped having suction completely. I emailed back and forth with Oreck several times, and they told me to check the inner gasket, the back, the tubing, etc., and everything was fine. The bag was new, the gasket was secure and spotlessly clean (because it had only been used five times. I then called the company and they said yes, it's under warranty, but my only option is to bring it to an Oreck service center (the closest one is 40 miles away) and have it fixed. I don't want it fixed. I want a refund. But the warranty doesn't offer that... only repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Terri D.

customer_reviews.title: Design issues
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because it lacked a rear filter. The exhaust airflow from the rear was powerful enough to knock over plants and other objects. The strap was inconvenient. The attachments kept falling off. Overall poor design. I wanted this to replace my non-commercial Oreck canister and ended up simply replacing its electric cord instead. And I’ve been an oreck owner for twenty years - 2 upright models and 2 canister vacs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: User unfriendly
customer_reviews.text: This is my third ore job. I loved the first two. This one is not good. The hose is too short, the extensions don’t stay connected, and the shoulder strap pulled apart within the first month.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Received used product
customer_reviews.text: Received the unit by USPS today with a sticker on the box from the mail service stating: "Attention Customer: Received Damaged".......red flag #1. Upon inspection, I found what looked like pet hair on the floor attachment....red flag #2. Then I inspected the unit vacuum bag and found it half full of pet hair.......red flag #3. The unit operationally tested OK cleaning out the car. With no broken attachments and good vacuum performance, I have decided to keep it. However, this is sub-standard customer care from the seller.......therefore 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lucius

customer_reviews.title: Brand New but Won't Power On... in a Working Outlet
customer_reviews.text: What they hey, Oreck? I just bought this but it won't turn on. I have two Oreck uprights, two Oreck air filtration systems and an existing (but older) Oreck canister vac. They all work. But not this new canister vac. It won't even turn on. ? Guess I'll need to send it back. Also... I don't like the new canister vac hoses at all. Bring back the old hoses. These accordion style hoses are no good.
customer_reviews.author: Just Some Guy, but Honest

customer_reviews.title: Love the vacuum but the extension wand has cracked down ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought at the nd of January 2018. Love the vacuum but the extension wand has cracked down the side and no longer holds a suction. The unit has been used maybe 6 times...and .apparently there are no returns or exchanges. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robby, Kim and the kids

customer_reviews.title: Great canister vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Oreck compact canister vacuum in 25 years. It's a nice compliment to the Oreck upright vacuum. I won't ever buy a different brand. I've had the same upright vacuum for over 20 years! I was surprised that the price of this commercial canister vacuum was cheaper than the regular canister. I love the heavy cord and its also longer than than the cord on the regular household model which allows me to vacuum both my kitchen and dining room floor without moving the plug. The suction power is great. The floor attachment is nicer than my last one. Very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: My favorite small portable vacuum....great for cars!
customer_reviews.text: Have used these small Orecks for years. This is my third and can't rave about them enough. This one is even better than the last...more bells and whistles. The perfect small use vacuum in my opinion and lots of power. This is an update 6 months later.....this Oreck has lost all its power after only 6 months of use. Really can't understand it as this was a total surprise. The unit was excellent to begin with and now I have to toss it. Not useful at all....just frustrating to even try to vacuum. Is there a warranty? Have to check that out.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Fire the engineer that put the orange power cord on it, he cost you one star.
customer_reviews.text: That said, I have an older Oreck canister vacuum and I liked it so much I got this one to put in my motorhome. I ended up putting the old one in the motorhome cause this one is much more powerful I kept it for the house. I like the telescoping extension tube and the overall fit and finish is excellent. It has a nice assortment of attachments. Other than the fat, stiff, and extra long orange power cord that you can barely wrap around the cable storage ears without falling off and unraveling, this appliance a good value IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Ran

customer_reviews.title: Hose won't stay on canister
customer_reviews.text: This is my second hand held Oreck Works great. My only complaint is that the hose keeps falling off the canister.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Jean

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself is light, but the power cord is heavier than the unit making it too heavy to use for very long. The hose is way too short. I have to hold the unit next to what ever I'm cleaning. It's impossible to hold something down while I use my other hand to clean the item. It has good suction but the cons outweigh the pros. Sorry I bought it. My old Oreck unit is light years a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Houston TX customer

customer_reviews.title: Very strong suction. Very handy size and easy to carry. Long cord is a Plus!
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum! It's exactly what I was looking for. I have a dog and birds inside. It gets in all the corners with the attachments. I use the brush for the ceiling. I use it for touch ups, my upholstery and whole house vacuuming. Others have commented on the smallness of the bag but I change my bag before it's full anyway so that's not a problem. The only cons I have is I'm 62 with arthritis all over and if I don't adjust it just right across my shoulders it gets painful, but I readjust it and it's ok. The quality of this vacuum is excellent for the low price. I would buy this again and again!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Bags are small and burst open
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my previous oreck compact vacuum which I LOVED! However, I am disappointed in this one. The vacuum bags are about half the size of the bags in my previous oreck. The last two bags, which were not completely full, burst open while inside the vacuum, what a mess! The plug continuously falls out of the outlet. I did consider purchasing another brand but I didn't because of how much I loved my previous oreck and that is has a 30 foot cord.
customer_reviews.author: Jen.C

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional suction power for a hand held vacuum!!!! I actually would have paid more for this product (USA). It is very sturdy and well made. Includes all attachments, easy to switch on and off, light in weight not burdensome or awkward. It comes with a Commercial cord, not a flimsy one, AND the length is ample. I put it together without reading anything. I love having disposable bags, as the dust and small particles stay in one place and do not 'fly' out when emptying like the bagless ones. Check out the ratings on Google, Fantastic!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: carolineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: (The floor sweeper attachment) I would love to give 5 stars but can’t with a product ...
customer_reviews.text: Please please Oreck read this. I couldn’t find a “contact seller” option. A part broke within 5 min of operating. Can I exchange just this part for a new part?! (The floor sweeper attachment) I would love to give 5 stars but can’t with a product that breaks so quickly. I love the power behind the suction of this vacuum. I love the attachments. It was initially uncomfortably heavy until I wore it like. Messenger bag inside of over one shoulder... then it was no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rose R Eisengart

customer_reviews.title: Parts don’t fit together
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have with this product is that the pieces don’t fit together. I tried to use the Slinky hose with the Ratcheting wand they don’t fit together. I tried to put the Slinky hose and the Floor Brush Nozzle together. Well, they don’t fit either. These tools severely limit areas that I can clean. If I have to be right on top of the object being cleaned what is the point of extended tools?
customer_reviews.author: B James

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for just 30 days past 1 year wty. Used occasionally for special home cleanups (bug invasion, remodeling dust, etc). While vacuuming dead bugs today it suddenly quit. Nothing I try works. Had one of the "home" models that did the same thing. That's why I bought a "commercial" model. The previous one had a bad switch that I ordered, replaced, and now works fine. I reckon I will tear this one apart to find the same switch problem......oh yeah, my strap broke off when I first used it aslo!
customer_reviews.author: Ernest H. Hays

customer_reviews.title: GOOD but..........
customer_reviews.text: Like most other people, the shoulder strap BROKE in an instant!! You'd think the company would engineer a new design because it's the design that fails. It's light enough to carry so not a big deal but will most like fabricate my own strap. The suction is good and no other complaints.
customer_reviews.author: shelley

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I used the Oreck vacuum for years and then stopped for several years. I decided to purchase the handheld Buster B version, as I used to be my favorite. I was excited to start using it, but within one month of using it, the shoulder strap broke off and the bottom of the extension wand broke off. I am unable to use it now, and had it for almost 4 months. I emailed the company and waiting for their response.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Harper

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product we use it for furniture, bed mattresses, window sills, and to clean our family car. My wife loves it because it’s light. It took her a while to get use to carrying it by the strap but after getting use to it, she loves it. Not to mention my wife has a shoulder disability due to cancer. We really love this machine compared to all the expensive uprights we have bought over the years that have that long hose attachment that tips over the upright vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: MrRzr

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Vacuum Rugs
customer_reviews.text: I may be uninitiated, but I had no idea this vacuum cleaner does not do rugs! We have carpeted stairs which I assumed it would work for along with area rugs but nope. Wouldn’t you think the product description would let you know it’s floors and fabric only? Who wants a different vacuum cleaner for floors and rugs? Not me.
customer_reviews.author: JSW

customer_reviews.title: but not in a good way.
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace the old oreck hand held canister vacuum. it is different , but not in a good way..the attached portion of the hose does not stay stretched...and makes it almost impossible to use...
customer_reviews.author: Dilana

customer_reviews.title: must read before buying
customer_reviews.text: bags are small so requires frequent replacement and bags are not less than the larger bags for other vacuums. Initially Power was better when I first used it. Does not do corners or molding too good with broom attachment. Strap is useless since it breaks almost within the first week. The hose needs to be longer. Would Not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: This is  worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Vacuum. After Auburn gave Alabama a beating this year in football, I had crumbs all over the floor. Alabama fans are notorious for 2 things. Missing teeth and eating w/ their mouth open. This did a great job cleaning up after the football game. This vacuum is well made for a condo w/ hardwood floors. The hose & cord is well made, don't let anyone tell you different. The suction is good and light enough to carry around. It's cord is long. Stop being cheap like a Alabama Fan and buy this vacuum. War Eagle!!
customer_reviews.author: Aulorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Great little Vac
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get the dog hair out of my truck and it works great for that job with one exception the flexible hose is too short. If about a foot of hose were added it would make this vacuum and excellent choice for cleaning up a car or truck. The long power cord is great and it has very good suction.
customer_reviews.author: SeaDog

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Oreck handheld vac. Our old one lasted about 30 years and we decided to get a new one, passing the other one down to one of our kids. Plenty of suction and all the tools you would need.
customer_reviews.author: Seawede

customer_reviews.title: You will spend more time untagling the cord! Frustrated beyond belief!
customer_reviews.text: Very Frustrating! I thought this one would be different from the other Oreck canisters, but actually it's worse! The cord continually tangles and it's so thick and long that is hard to untangle, you will hurt you back trying! The only good think is the suction is good, but the blowing out the back is just as powerful so it blows the dust everywhere!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Lieb

customer_reviews.title: This Vacuum Sucks....In A Good Way
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality vacuum for a good price. We paid more for a consumer type vacuum without the heavy duty cord and the push button extendable wand. Oreck always makes a good vacuum at a reasonable price. I would definitely recommend this compact vacuum for anyone looking for a easily transportable unit for small jobs such as stairs, upholstery, curtains, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Heavy for carrying
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize when I read the description that this cleaner can only be carried from place to place; it doesn't have small wheels to glide. I need to be able to pull my cannister along. The suction is very strong and it would be a good machine for folks who don't mind carrying it where they want it. The fault is pretty much mine.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Love my Oreck vac!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small lightweight vacuum to carry with me instead of pushing and dragging a floor model around. This fit the bill and I am very impressed with the suction. In fact I have never owed a vacuum with suction like this. The tools fit right on the vac so it is quick and easy to change them when needed. I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: threehounds

customer_reviews.title: Get a tie for that cord. It is wild and needs wrangling.
customer_reviews.text: Its alright... had some good attachments and a super long cord.. But the cord is oversized and to much to wrap around the hooks provided. So it's always a mess falling off and stuff. I also ow the regular black version a few years older and I expected a difference in power but didint really notice much more power than the origianl..
customer_reviews.author: Lively Ventures

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this vacuum cleaner. It’s light and has a long cord. I have wood floors throughout the house. My only gripe is how small the bags are. They really are tiny bags. Regardless, it’s worth it not to hurt my back every time and wanna clean my house.
customer_reviews.author: ShannyBird

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum, Horrible Hose.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for about 2 years now. The vacuum itself is great. It is what you would expect of Oreck. The hose however is too short for any practical use and becomes very uncomfortable in a very short time. As an industrial designer this solution is just poor ergonomics. I've kept this product hoping to find an after market hose that would work in place of the original (unsuccessfully). I would not buy this unit again. If I could I'd give 5 stars for the vac and 0 stars for the hose. I compromised at 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: WC

customer_reviews.title: The BEST small vacuum one MUST have
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we ended up buying it after a good ten years or more, might have been closer to 15. This has very strong suction and it really gets everything, especially when using the attachments, they get just about every place. I highly recommend and you wont regret buying this. It is also not that heavy.
customer_reviews.author: AaronDrTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Warning dangerous shoulder strap attachment, fell loose with 1st use!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this vacuum for quite awhile and was thrilled to find it on sale. The very first time I used the shoulder strap the connection came throgh the hole and the vacuum fell onto my foot. Luckily I don't think it broke any bones. The connection was preinstalled with the shoulder strap clipping onto a d ring so ot was not user error this is definitely a flaw in the product.
customer_reviews.author: RLS

customer_reviews.title: Regretted purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this vacuum a hour or so ago. I put it all together to use it. I vacuum 2-3xs a day. I have kids and 3 dog. 1 is a lab and sheds terrible. 1st thing I do not like is that it blows air out the back. My kids homework was on the table and all of that went flying everywhere. 2nd thing is it doesn’t pick up that great. I have a shark and a stain now and they’re 10x better, but I wanted something lighted and easier. Less than an hr and I am packing it back up and returning. I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and the one I have out of box and used already has already cracked where the hose meets the extension and also a piece off the front sheild of the head attachment. I wouldn't recommend if your looking for durability. I have an older version that I am still using and has been great but this one has alot of plastic parts and is cheap. Also the cord is thick and wont stay wrapped on the provided hooks for storing the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Second time buyer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this. First one I got three years ago. Held up until about recently (used daily). The coils on the hose began to tear, beyond the help of duct tape. Looked into getting just a new hose but that alone is 30 dollars so a whole new unit seemed like a better deal to me. Comes with a lot, even bags. Still using the old torn unit for especially nasty jobs, the amount of duct tape on the hose (70%tape,30%hose) makes it hard to move but will work ok for some stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portable Vacuum worth price
customer_reviews.text: Needed a portable vacuum that could pick up dog hair and spilled items off of wood and tile floors. Didn’t want a huge push vacuum. Compared and finally ended up with the Oreck. It’s a little heavier than I was anticipating but works well. Hose could be a few inches longer but since I’m only using periodically it’s okay.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jane Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Sucks like a heavy shop vac in a tiny package
customer_reviews.text: It works well. The tube came apart twice because it sucks so hard to the rug. The attachments are cheap but I can't get anything better for 100 bucks. I have the upright xl so I trust oreck more than others. It sucks like hell folks, and if I have to put a screw in tube I will. It's a keeper for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from Oreck
customer_reviews.text: Extension pole cracked the first time I used it. Replacement pole cracked after 1 use. This is not what I expected from Oreck. This product was advertised with ability to handle commercial cleaning jobs. The first pole cracked when I was vacuuming my car interior... the second pole cracked while vacuuming my living room... I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: gypsy4763

customer_reviews.title: Oreck Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Oreck canister vacuum cleaner for small jobs. I am happy I did. It is a little giant with lots of suction. I have the upright model and have been happy with it for many years. This small offspring is the perfect compliment. Nice and light and you can use the carrying strap or just carry it or place on floor. Good Product!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I got this vacuum for such a good price. It has powerful suction and it takes a lot to fill the bag. I was a little weary of the small bag but I can use it many times before the bag is full. I saw reviews about the shoulder strap coming off the vacuum. They must have fixed the problem because the strap stays in place and I can’t imagine it falling apart. Great little vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked the Oreck portable vacs. Like others have said the strap won’t on the vac given how it’s made. I took a needle and thread and tacked them down. Even though I shouldn’t have to it wasn’t no big deal to do. I wasn’t sure I would like the floor attachment but it works out pretty good. We have wood floors and It doesn’t scratch the floors. Over all I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Stover

product_meta.title: Oreck Commercial BB900DGR XL Pro 5 Super Compact Canister Vacuum, 30' Power Cord
product_meta.description: Style:Super Compact Canister VacuumCarry it by hand or shoulder. Compact, lightweight design. Powerful high vortex motor provides strong suction and long life. This compact canister has the power of heavier canister. 11 Accessories makes it the most versatile compact vacuum available. Power cord: 30 feet. : 1 year commercial.
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT only 5 pounds and has 1-quart capacity
ADJUSTABLE EXTENSION WAND and 4-foot hose help facilitate cleaning overhead vents, ceiling fans, and other high places
30-FOOT POWER CORD enables the vacuum to cover larger area

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,868 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Includes slinky hose, carrying strap, telescoping extension wand, dusting brush, upholstery tool, crevice tool and large floor tool for hard floor surfaces
